Separating and Combining Columns

tidyr::separate_wider_*() and tidyr::unite()

tidyr
column manipulation
tidyverse
Author

Jonathan Zadra

Published

March 20, 2023

Sometimes you may have columns in your data that you want to combine into a single column, or a single column that you want to split into multiple columns. These complementary functions are a simple way of doing so.

library(tidyverse, quietly = T, )
── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ──
✔ ggplot2 3.4.1     ✔ purrr   1.0.1
✔ tibble  3.2.1     ✔ dplyr   1.1.0
✔ tidyr   1.3.0     ✔ stringr 1.5.0
✔ readr   2.1.3     ✔ forcats 1.0.0
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
people <-
  enframe(
    c(
      "Jarred Prosacco",
      "Donnell Jacobs",
      "Cecily Schultz",
      "Boyd Stark",
      "Alverda Nolan",
      "Bose Kling",
      "Buel Nikolaus",
      "Adell Gislason",
      "Theadore Johnson",
      "Raynard Huel"
    ),
    name = NULL,
    value = "name"
  )

people
name
Jarred Prosacco
Donnell Jacobs
Cecily Schultz
Boyd Stark
Alverda Nolan
Bose Kling
Buel Nikolaus
Adell Gislason
Theadore Johnson
Raynard Huel 
people_sep <- people %>% 
  separate_wider_delim(name, delim = " ", names = c("first", "last"))

people_sep
first last
Jarred Prosacco
Donnell Jacobs
Cecily Schultz
Boyd Stark
Alverda Nolan
Bose Kling
Buel Nikolaus
Adell Gislason
Theadore Johnson
Raynard Huel 
people_sep %>% 
  unite(col = last_first, last, first, sep = ", ")
last_first
Prosacco, Jarred
Jacobs, Donnell
Schultz, Cecily
Stark, Boyd
Nolan, Alverda
Kling, Bose
Nikolaus, Buel
Gislason, Adell
Johnson, Theadore
Huel, Raynard

See also:

  • tidyr::separate_longer_*() for separating column values into multiple rows

  • dplyr::coalesce() for finding the first non-missing value from two or more columns
